25th June 1968
Dear Sir Charles,
You attended the meeting of experts on space communications
in Paris last January and supported the recommendation calling on
Unesco to draw up a convention for the protection of television signals
transmitted via satellite* For various reasons this recommendation is
not included in the programme which the Director General of Unesco is
submitting to the Unesco General Conference in October/November this
year* To remedy the omission it is essential that Governments should
write to the Director General of Unesco, by the beginning of September
(-) at the latest, on the lines of the enclosed model.
I woujjd be extremely grateful if you would take immediate
steps with ABU members to suggest to them that they, in their turn,
might press their Governments to write to Mr, Maheu, Director Gereral
of Unesco. To explain the need for the proposed convention, which
will primarily benefit developing countries, I have prepared an
(-■—) explanatory memorandum which I also enclose and which you may wish
to distribute to ABU members.
I am taking the same steps with ESU members, since without
the support of a large number of governments the proposed convention
win not see the light very soon and thus, yet again, technology will
have developed a splendid medium of communication which, for legal
reasons, cannot be fully exploited.
I therefore count on your full cooperation.
With kind regards.
Yours sincerely,
r Lj
G. Straschnov
